Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: 男の子
Entry.EnglishText: Boy

Entry.JapaneseText: 男の人
Entry.EnglishText: Man

Entry.JapaneseText: notice
Entry.EnglishText: Notice

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: バビログラード港
Entry.EnglishText: Babilograd Harbor

Entry.JapaneseText: バビログラード港・宿屋
Entry.EnglishText: Babilograd Harbor - Inn

Entry.JapaneseText: お父さんが詩を読んでくれたの。 ボク、うれしくって、 詩が大好きになっちゃった。
Entry.EnglishText: Dad read some poetry to me. I loved it! I'm a fan of poems now!

Entry.JapaneseText: ボク、ヒューマの事、 キライになりそうだよ……
Entry.EnglishText: I'm starting to really hate Huma now...

Entry.JapaneseText: 前は優しかったのに、 このごろ、ヒューマのお客さんの 荷物を部屋に運んであげても、 ありがとう、も言ってくれないんだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: They used to be really nice, but nowadays, they don't even thank me for carrying their things to their room...

Entry.JapaneseText: 外にいる人、 みんな、怖い顔して……
Entry.EnglishText: Everyone outside looks so angry...

Entry.JapaneseText: 一体、どうしたのかな？
Entry.EnglishText: What the heck is going on?

Entry.JapaneseText: 最近、お父さんが元気ないんだ。 前はお仕事のコト、好きだったのに あんまりやりたくないんだって……
Entry.EnglishText: Dad's not been doing so good lately. He used to love his job, but these days it's like he'd rather do anything else...

Entry.JapaneseText: どうしてだろ……
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder what happened...

Entry.JapaneseText: ねえ、このゴロゴロは、 どこから聞こえて来るのかな？
Entry.EnglishText: Hey! Where'd that shaking come from?

Entry.JapaneseText: ボク、蒼獣様の鳴き声だと 思うんだけど……違うかな？
Entry.EnglishText: I thought it was the Azure Beast's roar. Was I wrong?

Entry.JapaneseText: 空の色がヘンな風になってるよ！ ガジュマとヒューマが ケンカばっかりするから、 蒼獣様が怒ってるのかな!?
Entry.EnglishText: The sky's turned a weird color! Is the Azure Beast mad at Huma and Gajuma for always fighting?

Entry.JapaneseText: だとしたら、みんなで一緒に ごめんなさい、って言わないと ダメだよね！
Entry.EnglishText: We better get everyone to yell "I'm sorry" all at once, or we might be doomed!

Entry.JapaneseText: ボクはサニイタウンから この街に来たんだぁ。
Entry.EnglishText: I came here from Sunnytown.

Entry.JapaneseText: だから、カイリツは 気にしなくていいんだってさ。
Entry.EnglishText: So those Commandments don't really matter to me.

Entry.JapaneseText: ボク、お父さんと一緒に お仕事するの、好きなんだ。 客室係って楽しいんだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I work here with my dad. I like it a lot! Being a bellhop is so fun!

Entry.JapaneseText: 息子は外でみんなとともに 祈っている。
Entry.EnglishText: My son's outside praying with everyone.

Entry.JapaneseText: 私はここで静かに 本でも読みながら祈るさ……
Entry.EnglishText: I pray while reading my book in the peace and quiet here.

Entry.JapaneseText: 冒険小説!? 荷物の中だな…… チョット待って……
Entry.EnglishText: An Adventure Book!? In my luggage...? H-Hey, wait a minute...

Entry.JapaneseText: すっかり忘れてた…… ……どうぞ……
Entry.EnglishText: Please. I beg you, forget about this!

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>『冒険小説』を回収しました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You got back the Adventure Novel.

Entry.JapaneseText: お客さん、よくヒューマと 一緒にいられるね。
Entry.EnglishText: Good sir, you certainly are around Huma a lot.

Entry.JapaneseText: 私なんて、ヒューマの気配が しただけで、身震いするほど 腹が立つんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: As for me, I can't stand them. Being close to a Huma is enough to cause me to shake with rage!

Entry.JapaneseText: 私たちはサニイタウンから 来たんだ。だから、戒律は 気にせずやってるよ。
Entry.EnglishText: We're from Sunnytown, so we don't really care much about the Commandments.

Entry.JapaneseText: 街の人々はあんまり いい顔しないけどね……
Entry.EnglishText: The townspeople don't look too happy, though...
Entry.Notes: maybe more like: "The townspeople don't seem too happy about that, though", if it's referring to the prior sentence. -dragon

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマ……ヒューマ！ おまえらを見てるとな 身震いするほど腹が立つんだよ！
Entry.EnglishText: Huma... Huma! Just the sight of you makes me so mad I shake!

Entry.JapaneseText: とっとと出て行きな！
Entry.EnglishText: Leave at once!

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマどもが聖殿を独占しようとして ガジュマを港側へ追い出したんだ！
Entry.EnglishText: Those Huma! They wanted the shrine all to themselves, so they kicked out all the Gajuma and sent us to the harbor!

Entry.JapaneseText: こんな事が許されていいのかね!?
Entry.EnglishText: How could something like this be allowed!?

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマが港側に何の用だ！ ガジュマをこっちに追い出したくせに！ おまえらは聖殿に閉じこもってろ！
Entry.EnglishText: What could a Huma want here in the harbor!? You're the ones who forced us out here! Go shut yourselves in at the shrine!

Entry.JapaneseText: リフトも動き出して、 聖殿へも入れるように なったみたいだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I guess we can use the lift and go to the shrine again.

Entry.JapaneseText: まったく、ヒューマどもは 自分勝手だね……
Entry.EnglishText: Huma are so disgustingly selfish...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマの勝手気ままなやり方には もううんざりだ……！
Entry.EnglishText: I'm so unbelievably sick of Huma putting themselves over others all the time...!

Entry.JapaneseText: ヘンな音がずっと聞こえてますけど、 私には関係ないよ……
Entry.EnglishText: I did hear a pretty strange noise, but eh, it's got nothin' to do with me...

Entry.JapaneseText: 仕事をやるだけ…… ガジュマには肉体労働しか 回って来ないんだからね……
Entry.EnglishText: I'll work, but... All that they'll let a Gajuma do is physical labor...

Entry.JapaneseText: なんだよ…… 肉体労働のガジュマを 笑いに来たのかよ？
Entry.EnglishText: What, did you come to laugh at me? A Gajuma who's only good for labor?

Entry.JapaneseText: この前までは、自分が理由もなく ヒューマに腹を立てているのだと 思ってたんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: Until now, I thought I was just getting angry at Huma for no reason...

Entry.JapaneseText: でも、わかったよ。 ヒューマは自分たちのほうが 賢くて優れてると思ってるのさ。
Entry.EnglishText: I get it now, though. Huma all think they're better and smarter than us Gajuma!

Entry.JapaneseText: だから、私のようなガジュマには 客室係のように体力を使う仕事しか 回って来ないんだよ……
Entry.EnglishText: That's why they only give us physical labor jobs like this one...

Entry.JapaneseText: なんだよ…… 肉体労働のガジュマを 笑いに来たのかよ？
Entry.EnglishText: What, did you come to laugh at me? A Gajuma who's only good for labor?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……今に始まった事じゃないか。 昔からガジュマはバカにされて 生きて来たんだよな……
Entry.EnglishText: ...Yeah, it's no recent thing. Gajuma have basically existed to be ridiculed from the start.

Entry.JapaneseText: この国の平和のため、 すべてのガジュマとヒューマの 共存のために……
Entry.EnglishText: For the sake of peace across the land, and for the sake of all Huma and Gajuma coexisting...

Entry.JapaneseText: 私たち親子はサニイタウンから 引っ越して来て、 ここで客室係をやってるのさ。
Entry.EnglishText: My son and I moved here from Sunnytown. We work here as attendants, now.

Entry.JapaneseText: だから、蒼獣信仰の戒律は 気にせずに声をかけてよ。
Entry.EnglishText: That's why I'm fine with talking to you despite the Azure Beast's commandments.

Entry.JapaneseText: 親子で客室係をやってるんだ。 仕事は手際よく、美しく、手抜きなく。 誇りを持ってやってるよ。
Entry.EnglishText: My son and I work as attendants. We do our job well, keep things clean, and spare no detail. I'm quite proud!

Entry.JapaneseText: この前はお世話様……
Entry.EnglishText: Thank you for what you did. We'll never forget it...

Entry.JapaneseText: 子供の情操教育のために詩でも 読んできかせてあげたいが どんなものが良いのやら……
Entry.EnglishText: I want to read my son poetry to prepare him for school, but I'm not sure where to start, exactly...

Entry.JapaneseText: 何かおすすめの詩集は ないか……？
Entry.EnglishText: I don't guess you've got a Poetry Book to recommend, do you?

Entry.JapaneseText: はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>『詩集』を貸し出しました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You lent the Poetry Book

Entry.JapaneseText: どうも……。 うちの子に 読んで聞かせよう……
Entry.EnglishText: Thanks... I'll try reading this to my son.

Entry.JapaneseText: そう…… それは残念だ……
Entry.EnglishText: I see... That's a shame...

Entry.JapaneseText: 素敵な詩集だった……
Entry.EnglishText: That was a lovely book of poems...

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>『詩集』を回収しました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You got back the Poetry Book.

Entry.JapaneseText: 詩集はもう少し借りるよ……
Entry.EnglishText: I'd like to keep this Poetry Book a little longer...

Entry.JapaneseText: 正直、うちの子が こんなに詩を好きになるなんて 思っていませんでしたよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Honestly, I never expected my son to enjoy it as much as he does.

Entry.JapaneseText: 何が子供に影響するのかなんて 本当にわからないものですね。
Entry.EnglishText: I guess you never truly know what will have an impact on your kid, huh?

Entry.JapaneseText: ……どうも……
Entry.EnglishText: ...Thank you.

Entry.JapaneseText: 冒険小説の回収を頼まれたって!? ……ヒューマの言うことなんか 信用できないね!!
Entry.EnglishText: You were asked to retrieve an Adventure Book!? ...I don't trust anything a Huma says!

Entry.JapaneseText: 貸した本を返せだって!? ヒューマに本を借りた 覚えなんかないね！
Entry.EnglishText: Return the book I borrowed!? I don't remember borrowing a book from some Huma!

Entry.JapaneseText: ……あんたらヒューマには 借りは作らない。 詩集なんか、いらないよ。
Entry.EnglishText: ...I'm not owing anything to a Huma. I don't need your Poetry Book!

Entry.JapaneseText: 詩集があればなぁ……
Entry.EnglishText: If only I had a Poetry Book...

Entry.JapaneseText: あんたらヒューマには 借りは作らない！ 詩集なんか、いらないよ!!
Entry.EnglishText: I'm not owing anything to a Huma! I don't need your Poetry Book!

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『蒼獣像』 一見、文字のようにも見えるが、 この街の信仰の対象である 蒼獣様が描かれている。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>-Azure Beast Statue- What appear to be letters at a glance seem to instead be images of this town's object of worship, the Azure Beast.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『お客さま用引き出し・二段目』 ご自由にお使いください。 使い方はあなた次第。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Customer Drawer, First Level - Please feel free to use this as you see fit.
Entry.Notes: 二段目- nidanme - second stage? Not 100% on this one. -tl goodguy? -note edited by dragon

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『お客さま用引き出し・一段目』 潮騒ティーセット（無料）。 当地特産のジャスミンティーと お茶受けのドライフルーツをどうぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Customer Drawer, Second Level - Sea Breeze Tea Set (Complimentary). Please help yourself to locally sourced Jasmine Tea and dried fruits.
Entry.Notes: 一段目- ichidanme - first stage? Not 100% on this one. -tl goodguy

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『お客さま用ポット＆カップ』 当地特産のバビロ焼の陶器です。 いいお値段ですから、割らないよう 優しく扱ってください。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Cookpot and Cup for Customers - Pottery made using this region's special traditional method. It's very expensive, so please treat it with care.
Entry.Notes: バビロ焼 -Babiloyaki Guess the pottery making method is called "babiloyaki" after part of the town name and the word for frying/baking. Charming, but I couldn't quite fit it in here without it sounding awkward. -tl goodguy
